EVENT_NARRATIVE: Public submitted photos of a tornado SE of Wells over mountainous terrain of the Wood Hills area. No survey was conducted due to no apparent damage and inaccessible or remote terrain. Path length an width were guessed at.
EPISODE_NARRATIVE: Showers and thunderstorms produced gusty outflow winds and a brief tornado.

EVENT_NARRATIVE: Station (UP994) 3.1 SE West Wendover upr, Elevation 4408 feet.
EPISODE_NARRATIVE: A frontal passage produced showers and thunderstorms across much of northern Nevada. As a result, gusty outflow winds occurred.

EVENT_NARRATIVE: Station (CRSN2) Crane Springs Raws, Elevation 6414 feet.
EPISODE_NARRATIVE: A frontal passage produced showers and thunderstorms across much of northern Nevada. As a result, gusty outflow winds occurred.

EVENT_NARRATIVE: Mesonet station (TORNV) located 9.8 NE of Trinity Junction (NV DOT) reported a peak wind gust of 58 mph.
EPISODE_NARRATIVE: The combination of afternoon instability as well as increasing mid-level moisture pushing northward on the eastern flank of an upper level low that moved over SoCal and stalled over central-southern California. This upper feature introduced a daily chance of showers and thunderstorms during the first week of June.

EVENT_NARRATIVE: Station (COIN2) Coils Creek, Elevation 6745 feet.
EPISODE_NARRATIVE: A cluster of storms created gusty winds around the Sothern Lander and Eureka county areas.

EVENT_NARRATIVE: Mesonet station (MJBN2 - Majuba) located 21.0 WNW of Imlay, NV, reported a peak wind gust of 62 mph.
EPISODE_NARRATIVE: A compact upper low shifting eastward out of region leaving a moist and unstable airmass. The anomalous higher PWATS (90-95th percentile) and CAPE favored scattered thunderstorms across the region with heavy rainfall cores capable of flash flooding, gusty and erratic outflow winds, small hail, and lightning.

EVENT_NARRATIVE: The Carson City Sheriff's Office said a debris flow from mud was up to 1 to 2 feet in some areas of the parking lot of the Galaxy Fandango Theaters on S. Curry Street. The Galaxy Fandango Theater was closed so crews could conduct cleanup.
EPISODE_NARRATIVE: An upper low that settled over southern NV/UT encouraged the return of greater thunderstorm coverage during this period  with near severe storms bringing heavy rain and flash flood concerns to the region. These strong storm cells also brought along gusty, erratic winds, small hail, and plenty of lightning. Slightly below normal temperatures continued before returning to near normal the middle of upcoming week.

EVENT_NARRATIVE: Mesonet station (Slide-DRI) located 1.0 mi E of Mount Rose Summit, CA, reported maximum wind gusts of 94 mph.
EPISODE_NARRATIVE: A strong cold front brought strong gusty winds and a modest cooldown through this period. These strong winds also brought periods of choppy-rough lake waters, bumpy turbulent air to aviation concerns, and strong cross winds to high-profiled vehicles traveling on area roadways. Unseasonable freezing morning temperatures returned to Sierra valleys the first half of the upcoming week.
